title: [pytorch] Inconsistent automatic conversion of GPU tensors to NumPy arrays on CPU
body_html:
It seems that implicit conversion will copy onto CPU, while explicit won't, found this somewhat confusing.

import torch, numpy as np

a = torch.eye(2, 2).cuda()
print(np.linalg.inv(a))
# [[1. 0.]
# [0. 1.]]

print(np.linalg.inv(a.numpy()))
# TypeError: can't convert CUDA tensor to numpy. Use Tensor.cpu() to copy the tensor to host memory first.

print(torch.__version__)
# '0.5.0a0+bcd20f9'

body:
It seems that implicit conversion will copy onto CPU, while explicit won't, found this somewhat confusing.

```python
import torch, numpy as np

a = torch.eye(2, 2).cuda()
print(np.linalg.inv(a))
# [[1. 0.]
# [0. 1.]]

print(np.linalg.inv(a.numpy()))
# TypeError: can't convert CUDA tensor to numpy. Use Tensor.cpu() to copy the tensor to host memory first.

print(torch.__version__)
# '0.5.0a0+bcd20f9'
```
